What about running the class files through a decompiler like JAD, then
running the same class through javap and then getting the line count
difference (minus 4 comment lines JAD puts in) between the 2 files.  You
should be able to use this to derive the executable lines somehow.

Regards,

Steve Warsa

-----Original Message-----
From: Vladimir Bossicard [mailto:vladimir@...]
Sent: Tuesday, June 26, 2001 10:49 AM
To: junit@yahoogroups.com
Subject: Re: [junit] Test coverage metrics reporting tool


> Without parsing the source code there is no way to know.

That was my idea but even with parsing the source code, you face some
difficult problems with comments.   Did someone already found a solution
for a "clean" parsing? (maybe parsing the class files)

-Vlad
